intro: Curculigo maharashtrensis, commonly known as the Maharashtra arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Hypoxidaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
